intro: Rubus stipulosus, commonly known as the prickly blackberry, is a species of bramble native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in moist, wooded areas and is often found in the understory of deciduous forests. Botanically, it belongs to the Rosaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like roses and strawberries.
